title.value: Injury and violence in the context of sustainable development
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the collection of abstracts, which is 'Injury and violence in the context of sustainable development'.
title.quote: Injury and violence in the context of sustainable development

extractions.description: The paper is a collection of abstracts from the Bethune Round Table 2024 conference that focuses on global surgery, particularly highlighting challenges and innovative solutions in surgical care for underserved populations within the context of sustainable development. The abstracts address a variety of topics related to global surgery such as injury prevention, trauma care, surgical training, healthcare policy, and the use of technology to improve surgical outcomes in low- and middle-income countries.

type.justification: The paper consists of empirical studies presented as abstracts at a conference, discussing practical challenges and solutions in global surgery within the context of sustainable development.
type.quote: This collection of abstracts, focusing mainly on the theme 'Injury and Violence in the Context of Sustainable Development,' reflects the diverse range of topics discussed during the conference.

name.justification: The primary focus of the conference and the collection of abstracts is global surgery, addressing surgical care in underserved and marginalized populations.
name.quote: The Bethune Round Table (BRT) is an annual interdisciplinary meeting dedicated to the field of global surgery to discuss challenges and solutions to improving surgical care for underserved and marginalized patients locally, regionally, and globally.

name.justification: Injury prevention is a significant sub-field discussed throughout the conference abstracts, highlighting strategies to prevent injuries in low-resource settings.
name.quote: By showcasing these findings, the 2024 abstract supplement not only emphasizes the need for effective interventions, but also seeks to inspire a collective effort toward achieving the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals related to health and well-being.

name.justification: The abstracts address various aspects of trauma care, including management, prevention, and health system readiness, especially in low- and middle-income countries.
name.quote: Methods: We conduced a facility-based cross-sectional survey of hospitals in war-affected northwest areas of Ethiopia using a modified World Federation of Societies of Anaesthesiologists Anaesthesia Facility Assessment Tool, International Assessment of Capacity for Trauma, and WHO tools.
